top_categories.workout_context: Vapor Trail 125’s colorado high-altitude mountain gravel and competitive field demand explosive aerobic capacity — the ability to respond to surges without blowing up.
Vapor Trail 125 rewards athletes who can hold sustained power without blowing up — threshold is the engine that drives everything above Zone 2.
Vapor Trail 125’s colorado high-altitude mountains, mountain gravel demands rapid power changes — surge over obstacles, settle on smoother sections, repeat for hours.
Racing Vapor Trail 125 isn’t just fitness — it’s pacing, fueling, and executing when conditions deteriorate. This workout practices the race itself.
Over-unders train the lactate clearance you’ll need at Vapor Trail 125 when surges push you above threshold and you have to recover while still riding hard.
At 125 miles, Vapor Trail 125 punishes athletes who haven’t trained their body to produce power when glycogen runs low.
The G-Spot zone (88–92% FTP) is where you’ll spend the hardest sustained miles of Vapor Trail 125. Make this intensity feel like home.
Every session at Vapor Trail 125 intensity builds on this aerobic foundation — the endurance base is the soil everything else grows in.
Vapor Trail 125’s 9,000ft of climbing demands seated and standing versatility — the ability to change climbing style as gradient and fatigue dictate.
Critical power determines how long you can sustain above-threshold efforts at Vapor Trail 125 — a higher CP means more time in the red before failure.
Blended sessions combine endurance with intensity spikes — exactly what Vapor Trail 125’s colorado high-altitude mountain gravel delivers on race day.
Low-cadence force work builds the muscular strength for Vapor Trail 125’s 9,000ft of climbing — especially the grinding, low-speed ascents.

race_overlay.nutrition: Target 60–80g carbs/hour for Vapor Trail 125’s 125 miles. Start fueling within the first 30 minutes — early fueling prevents late-race collapse. Bonking at mile 60 is a nutrition failure, not a fitness failure.
race_overlay.altitude: Vapor Trail 125 with 9,000ft of climbing, much of it above 8,000ft demands altitude preparation. Arrive 5–7 days early for acclimatization. Expect 5–15% power reduction at altitude. Increase iron intake 4 weeks out. Hydrate aggressively — altitude increases fluid loss by 20–40%. Extreme altitude (10,000ft+); Long exposure at altitude.
race_overlay.terrain: Mixed terrain at Vapor Trail 125 requires surface adaptability. Include weekly rides on colorado high-altitude mountain gravel to build confidence. Expect: colorado high-altitude mountains, mountain gravel, 125-mile distance.

pack_summary: This 10-workout pack focuses on VO2max, TT Threshold, and Gravel Specific to prepare you for 125 miles of colorado high-altitude mountain gravel in Leadville, Colorado.
